title: Gather Requirements for BiorhythmOptimizer System
description:
Conduct extensive research and gather comprehensive requirements for the BiorhythmOptimizer system. This includes understanding user needs, identifying suitable biorhythm data sources, investigating scheduling algorithms, defining performance/wellbeing metrics, addressing data privacy and security concerns, exploring potential integration with existing systems or APIs, and researching third-party services or libraries to leverage for optimal functionality. The following specific areas require more attention: 
1. Data Collection and Analysis: Determine the most effective methods for collecting and analyzing biorhythm data. This should include a comparison of various data collection techniques (e.g., wearable devices, self-reporting) and analysis methods (e.g., machine learning models, statistical analyses).
2. Personalization: Identify how the system can be tailored to individual users' needs and preferences while also considering user feedback mechanisms. This should include a plan for collecting user data, strategies for personalizing the scheduling algorithm based on this data, and methods for gathering user feedback.
3. Real-time Adaptability: Investigate how the system can adapt in real-time based on changing biorhythms or user activities, including machine learning techniques for continuous learning. This should also include a plan for monitoring the effectiveness of the system's predictions over time and methods for updating the system as new data becomes available.
4. User Interface Design: Provide suggestions for a user-friendly interface that effectively communicates scheduling recommendations and incorporates feedback mechanisms. This should include wireframes or mockups of potential interfaces, usability testing plans, and strategies for iteratively improving the interface based on user feedback.
5. Cross-Platform Compatibility: Consider the development of cross-platform mobile applications as well as web interfaces to maximize accessibility. This should include a discussion of the advantages and disadvantages of each platform and a plan for ensuring consistency across platforms.
6. Documentation: Develop clear, concise, and comprehensive technical documentation for developers, testers, and other stakeholders. This should include a roadmap for the development process, detailed specifications for each feature, and examples of how to use the system's APIs.

title: Design System Architecture for BiorhythmOptimizer
description: Design the overall system architecture for the BiorhythmOptimizer project. This includes components for data ingestion, biorhythm analysis, scheduling optimization, user interfaces, and data storage. The design should consider scalability, performance, security, maintainability, fault tolerance, and edge cases (e.g., handling missing or inconsistent data). Define the interactions between components, data flow, and communication protocols. Identify potential third-party services or libraries to be integrated, with a focus on compatibility, licensing, and reliability. Provide detailed documentation for each component, including expected behavior and edge cases. Once design is complete, conduct code reviews of related designs and ensure adherence to project standards. Upon completion, update the RFC with these details, ensuring clarity and simplicity in presentation. This task will be decomposed into smaller tasks for easier implementation. Please review the design once decomposed and provide feedback before it moves to the next state.

title: Set up Development Environment
description: Set up the development environment, including version control, continuous integration/deployment pipelines, and development tools.

title: Implement Data Ingestion
description: Implement the data ingestion component to collect and process biorhythm data from various sources.

title: Develop Biorhythm Analysis
description: Develop the biorhythm analysis component to process and analyze biorhythm data using AI/ML techniques.

title: Implement Scheduling Optimization
description: Implement the scheduling optimization component to generate optimized daily schedules based on biorhythm analysis and user preferences.

title: Design User Interfaces - RFC (Revised)
description: Design intuitive and user-friendly interfaces for inputting biorhythm data, viewing analysis results, and managing optimized schedules. The interfaces should be responsive, accessible, and follow best practices for user experience (UX) design. Consider the integration with existing design system architecture, cater to defined user personas and use cases, provide clear documentation for each component and screen, and include wireframes or prototypes as part of the proposal. Ensure that the design is also flexible to accommodate future updates and improvements in biorhythm analysis algorithms. Incorporate feedback from the code-architect and task-decomposer during the design process. Update this RFC when the design phase is completed, including any additional details such as technology stack used for prototyping.
dependencies: Define User Personas and Use Cases

title: Implement User Interfaces
description: Implement the user interfaces based on the approved designs, ensuring responsiveness and accessibility.

title: Set up Testing Framework
description: Set up a comprehensive testing framework, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests.

title: Conduct Security Audits
description: Perform security audits to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities in the system.

title: Write Documentation
description: Create comprehensive documentation, including user guides, developer guides, and system architecture documentation.

title: Deploy and Monitor
description: Deploy the BiorhythmOptimizer system to production environments, and set up monitoring and logging systems.
